intro: Nassauvia sublobata, commonly known as the desert sand verbena, is a perennial flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations such as small leaves and deep root systems to conserve water. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Nassauvia sublobata is often found in sandy soils and is considered a valuable species for xeriscaping due to its low water requirements.
